case.name: SZBYO v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural & Indigenous Affairs [2006] FCA 262 (22 March 2006)

citation.tocase: SZCJH v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural & Indigenous Affairs [2005] FCA 1660
citation.text: 20 For these reasons, the 'information' concerning the student visa application was not 'part of the reason' for affirming the delegate's decision and therefore did not engage the obligations in s 424A(1): SZCJH v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural & Indigenous Affairs [2005] FCA 1660 at [23] . Alternatively, the existence of these independent bases for the decision means that a grant of relief would lack utility: cf. SZEEU v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural & Indigenous Affairs [2006] FCAFC 2 at [232] , [233].

citation.tocase: SZEEU v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural & Indigenous Affairs [2006] FCAFC 2
citation.text: 20 For these reasons, the 'information' concerning the student visa application was not 'part of the reason' for affirming the delegate's decision and therefore did not engage the obligations in s 424A(1): SZCJH v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural & Indigenous Affairs [2005] FCA 1660 at [23] . Alternatively, the existence of these independent bases for the decision means that a grant of relief would lack utility: cf. SZEEU v Minister for Immigration & Multicultural & Indigenous Affairs [2006] FCAFC 2 at [232] , [233].
